channel.title: 纽约时报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览纽约时报热门报道

item.title: Over six decades, Johnny Ventura, a.k.a. “the Elvis of Merengue” or “the Black Horse,” released more than 100 albums and won six Latin Grammys, including a lifetime achievement award, in 2006. He died at 81. https://t.co/qRULCyo2Dq

At least 233 staff members at two major San Francisco hospitals, most of them fully vaccinated, tested positive for the coronavirus. Most, according to a hospital official, involved the Delta variant. https://t.co/MA5vviDq89
Caeleb Dressel of the U.S. won his third gold medal in #Tokyo2020, beating his own world record in the 100-meter butterfly. https://t.co/xaBVwh3Z8s https://t.co/QQr2kSaXde

Months after the violent attack on the Capitol, Republicans have mounted a new effort to rewrite history, painting the accused rioters as patriotic “political prisoners” and blaming House Speaker Nancy Pelosi for the violence. https://t.co/JOaklTLczD

During introductions for the team épée competition, three U.S. fencers wore pink masks in an effort to protest the presence of a teammate who has been accused of sexual misconduct. https://t.co/PuMwh1W7wc

Kahlil Greene was elected as Yale’s first Black student body president in 2019, when he was a sophomore. Off-campus, he is known to his more than 447,000 TikTok followers as a self-described “Gen-Z historian.” https://t.co/0uzghe8AxZ
Elaine Thompson-Herah is the fastest woman in the world #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/bti78Fx2h3 https://t.co/KM1LitsFLQ

What’s the difference between running the 100 meters, the 800 meters and running a marathon? We invited three elite runners to run on the world’s fastest treadmill to find out. https://t.co/qKCDvtPHkI https://t.co/vlEMjbeAxH

Elaine Thompson-Herah of Jamaica broke the Olympic record in the women’s 100-meter dash, defending her gold from Rio. She ran the race in 10.61 seconds #Tokyo2020 https://t.co/DdKaJKRMVW https://t.co/tWFZ9MRUyC
Breaking news: Elaine Thompson-Herah of Jamaica wins 🥇the 100-meter dash. Jamaica swept the race with Shelly-Ann Fraser-Pryce in second and Shericka Jackson in third. https://t.co/emjBdJbH6N

The body of Danish Siddiqui, a Pulitzer Prize-winning Reuters photojournalist who was killed in southern Afghanistan, was badly mutilated while in the custody of the Taliban, officials said. https://t.co/c1fbHwYyBw

A third of white-tailed deer tested in four states during a federal study had been exposed to the coronavirus. The percentage was highest in Michigan, where 60% of the animals tested positive for antibodies. https://t.co/rVffbvGzqh
Walmart and Disney join a growing group of businesses requiring vaccination. https://t.co/gvURJeyV0p

In Opinion
"Anyone suffering from anxiety deserves compassion and love, rather than cruelty and judgment," writes Jennifer Finney Boylan in a guest essay. https://t.co/RNzJ0V7jYY

“I read all kinds of things about the vaccine and it scared me," Mindy Greene said.
She and her husband, the father to their four children, thought they'd be OK without it. Now he's on a ventilator, hospitalized with complications from Covid-19. https://t.co/fdZMSx1ylj https://t.co/sni4lhXtfR
Caeleb Dressel of the U.S. won his third gold medal, cementing his status as a breakout star of #Tokyo2020. https://t.co/uWnHZHsnfu
Katie Ledecky of the U.S. won gold in the women’s 800-meter freestyle, her final race of #Tokyo2020. It is an event she has dominated her entire career. https://t.co/0ygoruS885

Celebrities who cross genres can risk diluting their brand. Snoop Dogg — who can be in the new Addams Family movie, on a Corona commercial, on VH1 with Martha Stewart, run an investment fund and still release new music — is not one of them. https://t.co/CP4oJpyA3f https://t.co/6CoKLOskHQ
The U.S. women’s soccer team beat the Netherlands in a penalty shootout, advancing to the semifinals on Friday. See more photos from #Tokyo2020. https://t.co/KieJyuIxKr https://t.co/3tv1xN8rP4

Sunisa Lee became the fifth consecutive American woman to win the title of best all-around gymnast in the world on Thursday.
Her #Tokyo2020 victory resonated back home in Minnesota, particularly with its Hmong American community, in which she was raised. https://t.co/SQNnic1P9d https://t.co/xfZxD38G6V

Snoop Dogg smoked an enormous blunt while discussing his own cultural relevance and the persistent racism in the business world with our Corner Office columnist, @dgelles. “I just try to do me,” Snoop said. https://t.co/IVmioo971u
Some people who once rejected the coronavirus vaccine or simply waited too long are speaking from hospital beds, at funerals and in obituaries about their regrets. https://t.co/1ipcN3PiNK
Breaking News: Donald Trump’s tax returns must be turned over to congressional investigators, the Justice Department said, paving the way for the end of a yearslong fight. https://t.co/pS4ajpkaqp

Breaking News: Vaccinated people with breakthrough infections of the Delta variant may spread the virus to others just as easily as unvaccinated people, the CDC reported. Infections in vaccinated people are thought to be comparatively rare. https://t.co/ffJ4gIDgRw

In Opinion
"When George Washington wanted to protect his soldiers from smallpox, he made vaccinations mandatory," writes @ezraklein. "It worked." https://t.co/xoK1KqfqYx

In Opinion
"Many South Korean women refuse to return to antiquated ideals of unquestioning, uncomplaining mothers and caregivers," says Hawon Jung, a writer, in a guest essay. "Our feminist awakening has given us the language to redefine our lives." https://t.co/qZOh9Vi3Ea

Many U.S. employees are unlikely to take a "sad day" for their mental health or are scared of being punished for doing so. If you’re among the hesitant, experts say it’s time to start thinking about how to protect your well-being. https://t.co/DonkHPMIX1
Sunisa Lee won the gold medal in the individual all-around gymnastics competition, continuing a U.S victory streak that began when Carly Patterson earned the title in 2004. https://t.co/5FGblt78yl
Breaking News: Donald Trump pressed Justice Department officials in December to say the 2020 election was corrupt to help him try to overturn the results, documents show. https://t.co/aAiX7Xhr1t

Albert Bandura, a psychologist whose landmark studies transformed the field, died at 95. His most famous experiments, involving children's aggression towards an inflatable Bobo the clown doll, challenged basic tenets of classical behaviorism. https://t.co/jmckqZ0d7V

An San of South Korea won her third gold medal on Friday, taking first place in the women’s individual archery competition at #Tokyo2020. But some social media users have been attacking her — for her short haircut. https://t.co/5Hc7AHpxxT
Breaking News: Broadway theaters will require audiences to be vaccinated and wear masks when they reopen. Children under 12 must show a negative test. https://t.co/zP37bpL0td

The Delta variant is as contagious as chickenpox and may be spread by vaccinated people as easily as the unvaccinated, according to an internal CDC report. The immediate next step for the agency is to “acknowledge the war has changed,” it said. https://t.co/dt91Uv4MXH

Most countries are eager for Olympic glory. But China is so obsessed with winning gold that tens of thousands of children in government-run training schools are pushed from a young age to win at niche sports in hopes of dominating the top podium spots. https://t.co/rYDEN8cyFB
Breaking News: The Delta variant is as contagious as chickenpox and may be spread by vaccinated people as easily as the unvaccinated, an internal C.D.C. report said. https://t.co/hDs1FOIPMt

Sunisa Lee 🇺🇸 was impressive on the uneven bars in the women's gymnastics all-around at #Tokyo2020. Her routine is the hardest in the world, and earned her the best score of her group — 15.3. https://t.co/VAaKFc58qx https://t.co/u4111e8Ylm

🇿🇦 Tatjana Schoenmaker broke the world record in the women’s 200-meter breaststroke to win the gold at #Tokyo2020. 🇺🇸 Lilly King took silver and 🇺🇸 Annie Lazor took bronze. https://t.co/UqtR8TPzCW https://t.co/9FJHwMi7C4

Sunisa Lee, a Hmong American teenager from Minnesota, won the gold medal in the #Tokyo2020 individual women's all-around gymnastics competition. Rebeca Andrade of Brazil won silver and Angelina Melnikova of Russia took bronze. https://t.co/HvU4RZO7MD https://t.co/ztpDsh98tg

Disney World will require guests older than 2 to wear masks in indoor spaces starting Friday. The policy reversal follows a surge in local cases and a new mask recommendation from the CDC. https://t.co/vukxrV9ZEf
Breaking News: Military members will be subject to the same Covid-19 vaccination rules that President Biden outlined for civilian federal workers, the Pentagon said. https://t.co/ka3AVqXkPi
Breaking News: The CDC is expected to release data showing that vaccinated people may transmit the Delta variant, a finding that prompted its new masking advice. https://t.co/d4sbdnqVwR
A smartphone app launched by the French government gives $350 to 18-year-olds for cultural purchases like books, music and performance tickets. Many are spending it on manga. https://t.co/KuMiFJHLhc

Breaking News: Theodore McCarrick, the former archbishop of Washington expelled by Pope Francis, was charged with sexually assaulting a 16-year old boy in 1974. It's the first time such a high-ranking Catholic official has faced criminal charges. https://t.co/dr8IBcSKB1

As droughts continue and water temperatures climb, salmon in parts of Oregon and California are developing health issues. "Imagine the heat that we’re feeling. They’re feeling it 10 times worse in that river. They’re suffocating.” https://t.co/ECiRtm6aWP https://t.co/mwtrAdmClT

Rebeca Andrade of Brazil did not know if she would even qualify for #Tokyo2020. When the 22-year-old gymnast won silver in the all-around on Thursday, she became the first Brazilian to win any Olympic medal in women’s gymnastics. https://t.co/shdVZEByBh https://t.co/2kzl5oqE36

As the U.S. and the world watched, Sunisa Lee won the gold medal in the #Tokyo2020 individual women's all-around gymnastics competition. Here's a close look — move by move — at how she did it. https://t.co/IAlitdgqnd

The U.S.'s Sunisa Lee, 18, just won the women’s all-around gymnastics gold at the #Tokyo2020 Olympics.
To understand what makes Lee so good, we spent time with her in Minnesota as she prepared for her Olympic debut. https://t.co/nGKyC8PhuN
Sunisa Lee of the U.S. has won the gold medal in the women's gymnastics all-around at #Tokyo2020. https://t.co/j1Kp5LDHbu https://t.co/hIJqrEvjzy

Sunisa Lee, a Hmong American teenager from Minnesota who trained every day through grueling practices and painful injuries, won the women's gymnastics all-around gold medal on Thursday. https://t.co/V4qriK9qL1 https://t.co/nSFgL2woVW

To celebrate Louis Vuitton’s 200th birthday, the windows of the brand’s stores will be filled with trunks, the pieces that Vuitton founded his company on, designed by 200 people. Contributors include BTS, Drake and Gloria Steinem. https://t.co/7A4Xh9TYZi
